div.pre: 1183 Colophon, Ionia, c. 1962 Burial: c. 450 B.C.? (M) Contents: 3 EL fr., 177 AR fr., 1 PL Cyzicus: 1 Lampsacus: 2 Cyme: 1 Clazomenae?: 13 Colophon: 74 Ephesus: 10 Erythrae?: 1 Magnesia?: 26 Miletus: 2 Phocaea: 1 Teos: 38 Samos: 1 Caria: 1 Persian kings: 2 Unc. mints: 3 EL, 4 AR, 1 PL Disposition: Athens 53; Oxford 28 Kraay, SNI? 1962-3, pp. 5-13, illus. Varoucha, A Delt 1963 B 1, pp. 6-7, illus. This hd. is somewhat doubtful. In the lists of Kraay and Varoucha appear several 4th cent. coins which must be discarded (Kraay nos. 83-91, 105-6, 111, and Varoucha no. 32). The remainder may be one hd., or it may derive from two hd., an archaic of c. 500 B.C. and another containing material from the period c. 500-450 B.C. The picture is complicated by the appearance of another hd. at about the same time (no. 1168 above) with a distinct possi- bility of further confusion of material
